description._content: Title: Vicente Garcia [condemned murderer] Creator: Unknown Date: 1866 Part Of: Lawrence T. Jones III Texas photography collection Description: The prison cell portrait of Vicente Garcia was taken shortly before he was hanged for murder on June 22, 1866, in Brownsville, Texas on the prairie east of the city. Like his two Cortinista companions, Juan Vela and Florencio Garza, he was condemned for murder as a result of Juan Cortina's 1859 raid on Brownsville, Texas. The photographer was likely to be Louis de Planque or R. H. Wallis. Physical Description: 1 photographic print on carte de visite mount; 10 x 6 cm. Form/Genre: Cartes de visite; Photographs; Portrait photographs File: federal_army-1-09c.tif Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/u?/jtx,267 View Lawrence T. Jones III Texas Photographs at: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/jtx/
